segments.text: I look at the boy, his tiny fingers just inches away from those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a secret he shares with his sister, and I can’t help but feel amused.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sight of that unstable stool makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems to be in her own bubble, focused only on the plate in her hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t she feel the water pooling at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are like little thieves in the night, plotting their sugar heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight brings warmth, yet the scene feels so fraught with danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will suffer the consequences of this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scenario feels like a game they’re playing, oblivious to the risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's funny and terrifying, all at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR
